author: Muralidhara Khajane
text:
“It took 10 years to kill Osama bin Laden. It took 20 years to kill Veerappan” reads a scroll in the 141-second trailer of multi-lingual film Killing Veerappan by Ram Gopal Varma.

After crossing many hurdles, the film on the much-feared forest poacher is all set to hit the screen on Friday .

The Kannada and Telugu versions of the film starring Dr. Rajkumar’s son Shivarajkumar in a leading role as a police officer, NSD graduate Sandeep Bharadwaj as Veerappan, Parul Yadav, Sanchari Vijay and others will hit over 700 screens in Karnataka, Andhra Pradesh and Telangana on New Year day, according to one of the three producers B.S. Sudheendra.

The film was supposed to be released on November 15 to mark the 15{+t}{+h}anniversary of the release of Dr. Rajkumar, who was held captive by Veerappan.

However, it did not materialise because Muthulakshmi, wife of slain poacher, took exception to the film’s release. Later a Chennai-based producer went to court opposing the release. Finally, the decks were cleared, with Karnataka High Court dismissing the appeal. “The Kannada and Telugu versions will hit screens on Friday. Tamil audience will have to wait till February and northern belt has to wait till March to watch the film,” said Mr. Sudheendra. Screens in the border areas of Andhra Pradesh and Telangana, Ballari, Raichur and Hospet will start screening the film from midnight itself.
title: Killing Veerappan to hit 700 screens today
